sen.j: 京都所司代（きょうとしょしだい）は、織田信長が1568年に足利義昭を擁して上洛し、京都を支配下に置いたとき、室町幕府の機構を踏襲し、家臣の村井貞勝を京都の治安維持のために置いた機関。
sen.e: When Nobunaga ODA went to the capital with Yoshiaki ASHIKAGA in hand and put Kyoto under his dominion, he made his vassal Sadakatsu MURAI the Kyoto Shoshidai, in charge of maintaining the peace in Kyoto, imitating the organization of the Muromachi Shogunate.

When Nobunaga ODA went to the capital with Yoshiaki ASHIKAGA in hand and put Kyoto under his dominion, he made his vassal Sadakatsu MURAI the Kyoto Shoshidai, in charge of maintaining the peace in Kyoto, imitating the organization of the Muromachi Shogunate.

When Nobunaga ODA went to the capital with Yoshiaki ASHIKAGA in hand and put Kyoto under his dominion, he made his vassal Sadakatsu MURAI the Kyoto Shoshidai, in charge of maintaining the peace in Kyoto, imitating the organization of the Muromachi Shogunate.

sen.j: 貞勝は天正10年6月2日、明智光秀が信長を殺した本能寺の変のとき、信長の嫡男・織田信忠と共に二条城で討死してしまった。
sen.e: Sadakatsu died in battle at Nijo Castle along with Nobunaga's heir, Nobutada ODA, in the Incident at Honnoji, in which Mitsuhide AKECHI killed Nobunaga on June 2 in the 2nd year of Tensho.
Sadakatsu died in battle at Nijo-jo Castle along with Nobunaga's heir, Nobutada ODA, in the Incident at Honnoji, in which Mitsuhide AKECHI killed Nobunaga on June 2 in the 2nd year of Tensho.
Sadakatsu died in battle at Nijo-jo Castle along with Nobunaga's heir, Nobutada ODA, in the Incident at Honnoji, in which Mitsuhide AKECHI killed Nobunaga on June 2, 1582.

sen.j: 信長の死後、豊臣秀吉が京都を支配下に置いたときは、桑原貞成、杉原家次、浅野長政（この三名は、いずれも1582年から1583年の短期間）、その後前田玄以が京都所司代を務めている。
sen.e: While Hideyoshi TOYOTOMI ruled Kyoto after Nobunaga's death, Sadanari KUWABARA, Ietsugu SUGIHARA, and Nagamasa ASANO (all three in the period from 1582 to 1583), and later Geni MAEDA served as Kyoto Shoshidai.

While Hideyoshi TOYOTOMI ruled Kyoto after Nobunaga's death, Sadanari KUWABARA, Ietsugu SUGIHARA, and Nagamasa ASANO (all three in the period from 1582 to 1583), and later Geni MAEDA served as Kyoto Shoshidai.

While Hideyoshi TOYOTOMI ruled Kyoto after Nobunaga's death, Sadanari KUWABARA, Ietsugu SUGIHARA, and Nagamasa ASANO (all three in the period from 1582 to 1583), and later Geni MAEDA served as Kyoto Shoshidai.

sen.j: 1594年頃には石田三成・増田長盛両名に交替している（同年8月近衛信輔あて近衛前久書簡・陽明文庫所蔵）。
sen.e: Around 1594 it was alternating between Mitsunari ISHIDA and Nagamori MASHITA (Letter from Sakihisa KONOE to Nobusuke KONOE in August of the same year, in the collection of Yomei Bunko)
It had been alternated to both Mitsunari ISHIDA and Nagamori MASITA in around 1954 (Letter from Sakihisa KONOE to Nobusuke KONOE in August of the same year, in the collection of Yomei Bunko).
sen.cmt: 両名に交替した、とあるので、原文に合うように修正。原文がわかりにくいが、両名の間で交替していた、という意味では無いように思われる。
sen.e: It had been alternated to both Mitsunari ISHIDA and Nagamori MASITA in around 1954 (Letter from Sakihisa KONOE to Nobusuke KONOE in August of the same year, in the collection of Yomei Bunko).

sen.j: これらは室町幕府の職名を踏襲したものである。
sen.e: This was in keeping with the Muromachi Shogunate's titles.
This was in keeping with the Muromachi Shogunate's titles.
This was in keeping with the Muromachi Shogunate's titles.

sen.j: 京都所司代（きょうとしょしだい）は、江戸時代に京都の治安維持の任務にあたった部署である。
sen.e: Kyoto Shoshidai was the department that was responsible for keeping the peace in Kyoto in the Edo period.
Kyoto Shoshidai was the department that was responsible for keeping the peace in Kyoto in the Edo period.
Kyoto Shoshidai was the department that was responsible for keeping the peace in Kyoto in the Edo period.

sen.j: 本項ではこちらを中心に記述する。
sen.e: That is the main subject of this article.
That is the main subject of this article.
That is the main subject of this article.

sen.j: 京都所司代（きょうとしょしだい）は、江戸時代に京都の治安維持の任務にあたった役職である。
sen.e: Kyoto Shoshidai was the post that was responsible for keeping the peace in Kyoto in the Edo period.
Kyoto Shoshidai was the post that was responsible for keeping the peace in Kyoto in the Edo period.
Kyoto Shoshidai was the post that was responsible for keeping the peace in Kyoto in the Edo period.

sen.j: 本来、侍所の長官を所司といい、その代理を所司代というが、江戸幕府には、侍所は、設けられなかった。
sen.e: Originally, a Shoshi was the leader of a Samurai-dokoro, and a Shoshidai was his agent (dairi); but the Edo Shogunate did not have any Samurai-dokoro.
Originally, a Shoshi was the leader of a Samurai-dokoro and a Shoshidai was his agent; but the Edo Shogunate did not have any Samurai-dokoro.
sen.cmt: Samurai-dokoroの書体を統一。dairiは特に固有の名詞では無いし、agent で説明出来ているので省略。
sen.e: Originally, a Shoshi was the leader of a Samurai-dokoro and a Shoshidai was his agent; but the Edo Shogunate did not have any Samurai-dokoro.

sen.j: 江戸時代の所司代は鎌倉幕府におかれた六波羅探題や室町幕府におかれた所司代（侍所麾下、京都の治安担当）に倣って設置されたものである。
sen.e: Edo Period Shoshidai were set up after the pattern of Rokuhara Tandai in the Kamakura Shogunate, or the Shoshidai of the Muromachi Shogunate (under command of the Samurai-dokoro, in charge of security in Kyoto).

Edo Period Shoshidai were set up after the pattern of Rokuhara Tandai in the Kamakura Shogunate, or the Shoshidai of the Muromachi Shogunate (under command of the Samurai-dokoro, in charge of security in Kyoto).

Edo Period Shoshidai were set up after the pattern of Rokuhara Tandai in the Kamakura Shogunate, or the Shoshidai of the Muromachi Shogunate (under command of the Samurai-dokoro, in charge of security in Kyoto).

sen.j: 所司代の役所や、住居は、二条城の北に隣接した場所に設けられ、二条城は使用されなかった。
sen.e: The Shoshidai's offices and residence were set up on the north side of Nijo Castle, and did not use Nijo Castle.
The Shoshidai's offices and residence were set up on the north side of Nijo-jo Castle, and did not use Nijo-jo Castle.
The Shoshidai's offices and residence were set up on the north side of Nijo-jo Castle, and did not use Nijo-jo Castle.

sen.j: また、支配下に京都とその周辺の行政のために京都郡代が置かれたが、後に町中を担当する京都町奉行と周辺部やそこにある皇室領・公家領を管理する京都代官に分離するようになった。
sen.e: The Kyoto Gundai was also put in place to govern Kyoto and the surrounding area, later splitting into the Kyoto Machibugyo - responsible for the city - a division for the surrounding area, and the Kyoto Daikan, which managed the imperial household and court holdings there.

The Kyoto Gundai was also put in place to govern Kyoto and the surrounding area, but later split into the Kyoto Machibugyo, which was responsible for the city, and the Kyoto Daikan, which managed the surrounding area, the Imperial Household territory, and the Court Noble territory there.
sen.cmt: a division for the surrounding area (周辺部）は、京都代官にかかるので、挿入位置を修正。a divisionを削除。 later splitting→but later split - を削除してwhich に修正。皇室領・公家領を修正。
sen.e: The Kyoto Gundai was also put in place to govern Kyoto and the surrounding area, but later split into the Kyoto Machibugyo, which was responsible for the city, and the Kyoto Daikan, which managed the surrounding area, the Imperial Household territory, and the Court Noble territory there.

sen.j: 京都に置かれた役人の総元締めの立場にあったが、京都市政を預かる京都町奉行や宮中・御所の監督にあたる禁裏付などの役職は平時は所司代の指揮に従うものの、老中の管轄であった。
sen.e: Although he was the overall boss of government officials in Kyoto, and officials such as the Kyoto Machibugyo, in charge of Kyoto city government, and the Kinritsuki, who supervised the imperial court and palace, ordinarily followed the Shoshidai's commands, he was under the jurisdiction of the Roju.

Although he was the overall boss of government officials in Kyoto, and officials such as the Kyoto Machibugyo, in charge of Kyoto city government, and the Kinritsuki, who supervised the Imperial Court and palace, ordinarily followed the Shoshidai's commands, he was under the jurisdiction of the Roju.
sen.cmt: imperial court→Imperial Court 辞書では大文字になっているので修正。
sen.e: Although he was the overall boss of government officials in Kyoto, and officials such as the Kyoto Machibugyo, in charge of Kyoto city government, and the Kinritsuki, who supervised the Imperial Court and palace, ordinarily followed the Shoshidai's commands, he was under the jurisdiction of the Roju.

sen.j: 幕末動乱期は所司代だけでは、京の治安を治めるのは難しく、その上に最高機構として京都守護職をおき、所司代はその下に入った。
sen.e: Because it was difficult for the Shoshidai to keep the peace in the capital by himself during the period of upheaval at the end of the Edo era, the Kyoto Shugoshoku was put at the highest level of the organization; and the Shoshidai was subordinate to him.

Because it was difficult for the Shoshidai to keep the peace in the capital by himself during the period of upheaval at the end of the Edo era, the Kyoto Shugoshoku was put at the highest level of the organization; and the Shoshidai was subordinate to him.

Because it was difficult for the Shoshidai to keep the peace in the capital by himself during the period of upheaval at the end of the Edo era, the Kyoto Shugoshoku was put at the highest level of the organization; and the Shoshidai was subordinate to him.

sen.j: 松平信庸 (篠山藩主)（1697年－1714年）
sen.e: Nobutsune MATSUDAIRA (leader of the Sasayama-han Clan) (1697-1714)
Nobutsune MATSUDAIRA (leader of the Sasayama Clan) (1697-1714)

sen.j: 酒井忠義 (若狭国小浜藩主)（1843年－1850年）
sen.e: Tadaaki SAKAI (Leader of the Obama-han Clan, Wakasa District) (1843-1850)
sen.cmt: 藩主とあるのでLeader を補足、下記と統一。 Obama Clan→Obama-han Clan
sen.e: Tadaaki SAKAI (Leader of the Obama-han Clan, Wakasa District) (1843-1850)

sen.j: 酒井忠義 (若狭国小浜藩主)（1858年－1862年）
sen.e: Tadaaki SAKAI (Leader of the Obama Clan, Wakasa District) (1858-1862)
Tadaaki SAKAI (Leader of the Obama-han Clan, Wakasa District) (1858-1862)
Tadaaki SAKAI (Leader of the Obama Clan, Wakasa District) (1858-1862).

sen.j: 織豊政権の京都所司代について
sen.e: Kyoto Shoshidai of the Ota-Toyotomi Government
Kyoto Shoshidai of the Oda-Toyotomi Government
Kyoto Shoshidai of the Oda-Toyotomi Government

sen.j: 伊藤真昭『京都の寺社と豊臣政権』（法蔵館、2003年） ISBN 4-8318-6031-X
sen.e: "Temples and Shrines of Kyoto and the Toyotomi Government" by Shinsho ITO (Hozokan, 2003) ISBN 4-8318-6031-X
"Temples and Shrines of Kyoto and the Toyotomi Government" by Shinsho ITO (Hozokan, 2003) ISBN 4-8318-6031-X
"Temples and Shrines of Kyoto and the Toyotomi Government" by Shinsho ITO (Hozokan, 2003) ISBN 4-8318-6031-X
